website_summaries.verdict: An incredibly heavy-duty aluminum dual monitor stand that offers 2 ways to mount and extra-long arms that simplify adjusting the screens to their correct heights.
pros: Frees up space by removing monitors from desktop
Each arm supports a monitor up to 20 pounds
Tilts screens either horizontally or vertically
Storage within arms keeps wires neat
Set-up instructions are clear and easy to follow
cons: More costly than other dual stands
May need some trial and error to get the tension just right

customer_reviews.title: Monitor plate wouldn't adjust.
customer_reviews.text: Defective monitor plates wouldn't adjust after half hour of trying. I'm pretty handy and couldn't get that thing to move. Monitor could only face the ceiling. Pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: Vslm

customer_reviews.title: Could not adjust monitor tilt. The screen is fixed ...
customer_reviews.text: Could not adjust monitor tilt. The screen is fixed facing the ceiling. The screw to loosen the tilt does nothing. Cheap junk
customer_reviews.author: connor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, holds two 24' wide screen monitors
customer_reviews.text: Very nice , holds two 24' wide screen monitors. I just got a sit stand desk and the monitors were to low. I removed the 3 inch neck pipe and replaced it with an 8 inch neck pipe (You can get at ACE), now I can get my monitors 12+ inches off the desk surface. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My fix for plate stuck facing upward problem
customer_reviews.text: So this is going to seem kind of stupid but my fix for the stuck plate facing upward was physical leverage. I had already tried mounting the monitor as some had suggested but it still wouldn't turn. I had also tried turning it free hand with no luck. Anyway, only when I braced it - see vid - would it turn. Now works great. Maybe mine was never really broken, but give this a shot before you return.
customer_reviews.author: hausdaddio

customer_reviews.title: Get your monitors at the perfect height! Save your neck!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed the Amazon Bascis dual arm system on my Apex Desk and I am so delighted. I have attached a 28" monitor on the right arm (upside down, I might add, to get the height right for me) and one of the laptop mounts for the other arm to get both screens up at optimal height. I love it! Vibration is minimal from my typing and it allows me to put my Apex desk at the absolute perfect height. Zero hunching. Cords are kept out of the way, everything looks clean, and I have so much desk space back. I'm so so happy. Highly recommend. GET ONE. p.s. Goes great with your
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: The arm that attaches to the monitor is completely useless, Just as all the other negative reviews mention, there is no way to release the tension and adjust the monitor position. I called Amazon Tech Support, and they hung up on me as soon as I mentioned the product I was calling about and the reason for calling. No more Amazon Basics products for me.

customer_reviews.title: Neck pipe is very short
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the arms work well, they're sturdy and easy to put together. The main issue I take with these is the neck pipe that comes standard with the setup, it's only 3 inches tall, so it's VERY short. When I got my monitors both set up I realized that when mounted on the arms with the 3-inch neck pipe, they sat very low and in fact were lower than they were when I had them attached to their normal desk mounts. I've seen others on here mention that they replaced the 3-inch pipe with a taller one and I will probably be doing the same sometime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: No quality control on this product
customer_reviews.text: I spent my sunday afternoon setting this monitor arm up and fidgeting to try and get it to work correctly. Ultimately, my problem was the screw to adjust the tension of the monitors would not adjust the tension at all. My monitors were stuck staring at the ceiling. The other tension screw attached to the main arm also did nothing. The arms are completely nonfunctional if you are unable to adjust the rotation in 2 dimensions. If you notice recent reviews, this seems to be a very common problem. Do yourself a favor and don't even consider these. They have high ratings, but the ratings do not reflect the real quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Holds a heavy Apple Thunderbolt Display with appropriate tension adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: Good design and great build quality. I needed something to support a 27" Thunderbolt display and a lot of other products seemed iffy about the weight limits. At first I was disappointed that the arm wouldn't lift the monitor, and I tried messing with all the hex bolts on the joints to no avail. After I did some digging I realized that the tension adjustment is down the shaft of the upper arm and has to be accessed with a monitor detached using the long t-shaped allen wrench that's included. After a good bit of turning, the arm holds this heavy monitor up very steady and still adjusts position and angle fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Dees

customer_reviews.title: Tilting up issue solved
customer_reviews.text: Once we got it figured out the issue, everything worked out great. We had the same issue a lot of others were having. The monitor was tilted up facing the ceiling. You have to loosen the tension screw (turn it to the left). The tension screw is hidden and you need to loosen it before attaching the monitor. Then use strength to adjust it. The tension spring is just that.. a tension spring. It’s not just going to easily move.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Liebrand

customer_reviews.title: Kinda hard to figure out at first with included instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked that it was hard to figure out how to install the monitor to it. You would swear that it's as easy as 1 2 3 but no. Your best starting off point is throwing the instructions in the garbage and figuring it out yourself because the included instructions although present were not very clear. Product was a bit defective for titling. Amazon did give me some reimbursement back so the customer service was excellent, however, as far as the product goes overall not to impressed with the range of motion. Some parts were a little bit loose. IF you get these for a deal their OK but otherwise its average.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: This thing is rock-solid, easy to install and adjust. If you're wondering about flaws, here they are: - The decorative caps in the base are easy to install and almost impossible to remove; rotate them 180 degrees (so the plastic clip doesn't latch) and you're good to go - When used with a laptop tray, you can't position the laptop aligned with the base easily; just offset the base mount - The way to attach cables to the upper part of the arm is with wire ties, and the tie mounts are not great And even then, it's a 5-star product.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing overall.
customer_reviews.text: Good: they are reasonably stable, rugged, and easy to put together. Bad: The vertical travel isn't quit enough to bring the monitors up to eye-level for me (5' 6") so I'm constantly looking slightly down. It isn't quite so bad when I'm sitting down because I end up slouching, but when I'm standing it's just not great. I also have quite light monitors and I can't relax the tension enough to make adjusting the monitor easy---in particular the tilt direction where adjusting them feels dangerous for the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works with 2x 27" monitors.
customer_reviews.text: I considered buying one of these for months if not years, but could never find a clear photo or answer about whether or not it could hold two 27" monitors. IT DOES. And it does it well. Super easy to assemble and much stronger, more stable, and easy to adjust than the single-monitor low-cost stands I'd previously bought. For reference (and in case it helps anyone else's search in the future) this dual-monitor stand is holding a pair of Dell 2715 screens beside my (not mounted) 27" iMac. All are aligned well, with lots of space for adjustment and I have a ton of free desk space now.
customer_reviews.author: Max Fento̶n

customer_reviews.title: Great way to free up space on your desk
customer_reviews.text: The range of motion on this monitor stand is great, and it feels very sturdy and well made. It can feel somewhat stiff when moving the monitors at times but not it any way that would bother you much. The free space the monitor stand provides is well worth the money. The install was fairly easy and quick as well
customer_reviews.author: Brian McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I just received the dual monitor mount and it gets one star because mine has a mounting plate defect on the upper arm that won’t budge or allow monitor to tilt. It is stuck facing the ceiling no matter how much I mess with the tension screws. Waiting for a replacement so hopefully it will work this time.
customer_reviews.author: DC5enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Great If Not Against The Wall
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is pretty good monitor stand especially if you are looking to clear up some space on your desk. It has a nice sturdy, wide base. It was pretty easy to setup. My only criticism would be range motion against a wall. If you want to push the monitors back so they are not that close to you, you will find it not particularly useful if you are against a wall. You will only be able to push them out to the side, which looks strange as there will be a gap. To close the gap, bottom needs to extend back to allow for monitors to be pushed back and close together.
customer_reviews.author: Santos

customer_reviews.title: Ergotron quality at a lower price, win win!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and bought this mount. I already had a Ergotron single display mount for my Vizio tv. I wanted to get my 34" Acer B346c and 24" Dell E2414H monitors off of my desk. I did some research. I found out that Ergotron makes these mounts for Amazon's Amazon Basics. I see no quality difference between my Ergotron and this mount. I also love the black color. My Ergotron has polished aluminum. When I received the mount. Ergotron's name was on the shipping label for when they shipped it to Amazon. What is not to love. Ergotron quality for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Dale M.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, looks good.
customer_reviews.text: No issues with it, but make sure your desk has enough room to mount the C clamp, but even then I felt better drilling a hole and mounting it that way. Although they offer great flexibility, I wish they would go a bit higher, and beware with heavier monitors as even when you tighten the spring, my ISP panel sags lower than my lighter TN panel when brought to the max hight.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Baltz

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, import note about cable management and cable tension
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic stand however I'd like to make one note about my issues. The only problem i have is that at the pivot point in the arm itself has little to no resistance at all. They can swivel with hardly any force applied. While this might be nice for some, for me it is more annoying than convient. I cable manage almost every port on my monitors using this stand. While the management options are nice the swivel point means that the tension on the cables themselves can affect the monitors positioning. I just would have liked to have seen a bit tighter fit to prevent unwanted movement from cable tension.
customer_reviews.author: Harold H.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made mount good for stand up desks.
customer_reviews.text: This mount is made of high quality materials. It's very easy to install. I have a customized Ikea standing desk setup (picture below) and this mount was a good choice. The price is right. You will need extra long cables, and will want to leave extra slack near the monitors when installing. Overall I'm very happy with this purchase and another person in my office bought one as soon as looked mine over.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Horton

customer_reviews.title: A very smart dual stand for two 32" Samsung Curved flat panel monitors
customer_reviews.text: The product was packaged very well. All materials were accounted for and very well packaged. From un-boxing to complete install took all of 15 minutes. Very satisfied with my purchase. Took advantage of the Amazon sale and really got a great deal for it. Clears up the desk top clutter due to the monitor stands that came with the monitors. Now, the monitor footprint is literally 7-8 inches. Leaving plenty of room for organized clutter.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Alvar

customer_reviews.title: A versatile mounting system - very used to people who need accommodations
customer_reviews.text: Due to chronic pain I'm living what I'm calling recliner life. I need to use the recliner at work to keep my pain in check. This support allows me to bring the monitors close to me when I'm getting into my chair and push them away when I'm getting out of the chair. Because of this mount I'm working in the office more. It was also pretty easy to assemble. There is something Ikea like about the instructions but we got through it without too much grief.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. It arrived fast and was easy to set up. I had a little trouble figuring out which mounting option to use due to the instructions and this product being manufactured in China. But once I was able to determine which option worked best for my desk, everything else was a piece of cake. I now have my monitors mounted and and am good to go. I was a little worried about how stiff the arms were once I had them out of the box but once I had my monitors on them, they moved and then stayed put. I only wish I had done this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Exaggerated weight limits.
customer_reviews.text: It works, flexible. Easy set up. Problem. It says the max weight it can hold is 20lbs. I have a monitor that is 15lbs and another that is 10, and the arm that has the 10lbs monitor gave out within a few months. Now I support the 10lbs monitor arm with a few books as a pillar. Tightening the hinges does nothing, it just doesn't hold up the lighter monitor. If you choose to buy it keep an eye on the (facing the mount) right arm within the first 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: GrizzlyEngine

customer_reviews.title: This one is sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This monitor stand was exactly what I needed! This one is sturdy and easy to install. The tension and positioning was smooth and easy. I installed this by using the hole assembly rather than the clamp. This was a selling feature for me because of shape and orientation of my desk. I am using this stand with two ASUS VS228H-P 21.5" Full HD 1920x1080 HDMI DVI VGA Back-lit LED Monitors. One thing to note is that when using the center hole you lose your wire management capabilities. In other words, there's not much room for cables to go through the hole once you install the post. I was able to get my power cable through as shown in the pic.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stand
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous to buy this for my aging 27" Cinema Display - the thing weighs in excess of 20 lbs. While the arm drooped initially, after adjusting the tension, it's been holding it without any issues. I actually ordered a lighter replacement monitor, because I didn't expect this arm to withstand the weight.
customer_reviews.author: impitbosshereonlevel2

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: My desk looks much better with this holding my two differently-sized monitors (32 inch and 29 inch). Works very well, monitors are easy to adjust position, holds them at the perfect height for me. Since it is a dual-arm mount, there are some inherent limitations with positioning one arm in relation to another, and I found that in order to get my monitors where I needed them to be in my particular case I had to set my desk a bit further from the wall than I did without, but not significantly so. Individual arms are certainly more flexible, but dual-arms is convenient and still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Ap

customer_reviews.title: Great...until is starts sinking
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product but after about 5 months, one of the arms will not stay raised and sinks down to it's lowest point. After looking through the pictures posted, there is a hidden pin that accepts a 4mm hex tool to tighten. That resolved the issue, but I am concerned at how quickly the pin loosened. I'm hoping this doesn't turn into a monthly adjustment I need to continue doing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Newman

customer_reviews.title: pretty easy to assemble and attach...
customer_reviews.text: I tend to delay projects I find to be daunting. The prospect of setting up this device up was no different. The parts are relatively heavy and there were more a few pieces. But I dove in and found that it wasn't nearly as difficult as I expected it to be. Really, it's just a few screws and drop the pieces into the holes. I have two monitors and I just bought a Jarvish desk. I needed to create more room on this new desk. Mission accomplished!! Now I have lots more room!!
customer_reviews.author: slick

customer_reviews.title: High quality, sturdy, but short and limited placement
customer_reviews.text: These arms are capable of holding heavy screens, but the base is short. Screen placement is very limited, especially for large screens, due to the lack of height at the base. I've combined this set of arms with a different base to get a taller range of placement, which I find almost necessary. I think you'll be lucky if you have large screens and these give you the placement you need.
customer_reviews.author: Cliffton Mcintire

customer_reviews.title: Stability, decent range of motion
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble, took about 15 min tops, the adjustment screws are not difficult to find, however I can see how some may have missed them as per the other reviews, there are some very useful videos online on how to set them up if needed. Now, about what they are for, they definitely do the job, I can easy move my monitors out of the way if needed, and bring them back to when I use them, tilt is not the best, but works, rotating them also works fine, no issues there.
customer_reviews.author: Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe is that my 27" monitor is a bit too heavy and settles about midway down from the highest it can be. It would be nice if there was a locking mechanism to lock a certain height. Still a wonderful dual monitor desk mount stand. EDIT: There is a lock. It's an allen head screw that is located on the end of the arm it's a little difficult to see.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but not as flexible as you might think...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dual monitor set up. Even though they are AmazonBasics, the quality of the product is amazing. Ive heard that these are actually made by Ergotron and just rebranded but who knows. Either way, very sturdy, amazing quality. However, I couldnt quite get them to work for my need. The arms can be a bit big and limited in range of motion. I eneded up returning these and getting a different cheaper option.
customer_reviews.author: Sajith

customer_reviews.title: Best mount ive ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: Researched mounts for over 10 days and came to this one, ordered it and arrived all in one piece...packaged very nicely. Directions were great and spot on.. easy to install. It's hanging up my 2 27'' Viewsonics right now, i will admit..also make sure you got some room behind your computer desk because these arms are very big and will need some room because they'll bang up your walls. All in all great mount and the gas springs are just so great, the only downfall is the plastic lids for wire management, those suck.
customer_reviews.author: james barlow

customer_reviews.title: Unable to stay in desired position.
customer_reviews.text: This was difficult to adjust. It would always shift no matter how much I tightened the screws. I had to buy a new mount because this was not working.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah N. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Defective item sent twice
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this item a few days ago only for it to arrive defective. The screw that adjusts the backplate that attaches to the monitor will not loosen the backplate at all on either arm. I called product support and they sent me a replacement only for that to arrive today with the same defect in both arms. At a glance, this product seems like it would be great, but it arriving with no defects seems like a roll of the dice. Good luck if you decide to purchase these.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Strong

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I have relatively light monitors, and was able to set the tension to a level where I can freely move the monitors with my hands but they don't sag on their own. Excellent if you want your monitors to be mounted higher, need extra desk space that is currently taken up by stands, or like to switch between monitor positions depending on what you're doing. I use both monitors when I'm programming, then push the second monitor aside and move the first monitor front-and-center when I'm gaming.
customer_reviews.author: K. F.Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: 2 34" LG Monitors
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and offers you greater capabilities with your desktop set up. I really enjoy having them. I was able to make more room on my desk and also move the screens closer to my face. These are heavy duty and will hold larger monitors easily. You cannot get cheaper ones! Pay attention to the size and weight they allow. These were really easy to set up too.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Ninja®Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Decent alternative to the Ergotron
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased to use at work for my boss. I have the Ergotron setup that works very nicely. These are a cheaper version (50%) of the Ergotron. The arms are all black instead of the shiny chrome. The springs hold in the arms but are shakey when you bang on the desk. They are a good alternative to the Ergotrons and I would buy them again if needed. The setup was clamped to the back of his standup desk. They hold 2 Dell ultrasharp 24" monitors without interfering with the operation of them. Mounting the monitors gains you extra space on the desktop and also lets you pull them closer to you if you can't see something well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Caruso

customer_reviews.title: Holds 27" cinema display and 27" dell flat panel easily
customer_reviews.text: I almost sent this back because the 27" Apple Cinema Display is quite heavy and when I initially put it on the arm, the arm hit the desk immediately. It turns out the tension just needed to be adjusted. A lot. But once that was done, it held in place without a problem despite that particular display being 3 pounds over the maximum weight specified for the arm. My other display is a 27" Dell flat panel which is considerably lighter than the Apple. The dual arms allow me to have both side-by-side. With some software that allows me to share one keyboard and mouse across two machines, I can now effortlessly switch between platforms with both displays perfectly positioned.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Potts

customer_reviews.title: Dual Thunderbolt displays works great.
customer_reviews.text: Dual Thunderbolt displays works great. I was a little concerned, as the specs list two different weight limits. It did require tightening the spring quite a bit. I used my luggage scale to measure how much weight (pull) the arm supported out of the box, and it was ~ 5 pounds. After multiple turns of the included hex wrench, it's able to support the TB weight.
customer_reviews.author: The Claussens

customer_reviews.title: A Real Amazon Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a really high quality, fully adjustable, monitor stand that is easy to install. It comes with first class packaging, all of the parts to install it as you want, quality easy to understand instructions, and the tools needed to get the job done. I used it to support two 24" monitors and the install went quickly without any issues whatsoever. Moreover, the price was truly modest considering the quality received. I would rate this as my Amazon best buy of the year!
customer_reviews.author: SRM

customer_reviews.title: They work really well
customer_reviews.text: I came back to find the manual to figure out how to mount a new monitor and realized I should leave a review. I'ven been using these daily for about a year and they're absolutely perfect. I can move my monitors aroound to get the most comfortable view no matter what I'm doing. In the normal position, they come down and hide all the cables, modems, hubs, cords etc and when I need to get to anything, they move right out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: DRK

customer_reviews.title: maybe i got a lemon? or two?
customer_reviews.text: the one i received did not respond to attempts at adjusting the tilt mechanism, and was thus unusable. at first i was completely unable to move that screw. then i had a brief moment of triumph when it seemed that, contrary to both common sense and the printed instructions, perhaps the thing was just threaded backwards, as it became willing to move in the direction that should have meant tightening. but my triumph was shortlived, in that the now moveable screw still didn't adjust the tilt angle. after chatting with a "support" agent i received a replacement unit, which appeared to suffer from the same ailment. so i gave up and bought a Jarvis arm (on sale that day) instead.
customer_reviews.author: harpa413

customer_reviews.title: It's a great, very robust product but unfortunately there is a ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this five stars, I sat watching for the FedEx truck all day waiting for this. It's a great, very robust product but unfortunately there is a serious flaw, which is that the desk-mounted arm they give you is ridiculously short and you're therefore going to be stuck buying another one which will cost probably $30 for one of appropriate quality. I like it, it could just obviously be better. It's a no-brainer to increase arm overall height on this, Amazon. It's possible they used a low desk mount so that they could pack and ship it more easily, good product, not great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Increased productivity and holding up two large monitors with ease!
customer_reviews.text: Having two screens instantly improved productivity by eliminating the need to keep opening and closing windows. I put two 24" Dell monitors on this system with no problems at all. I am guessing for anyone who said their stand didn't support the monitor, they didn't make the proper adjustments that were in the instructions. The single adjustment was made very simple by turning hex a bolt with the included tool and took seconds to do. I just purchased a second one for another person in our office who after seeing this one had to have one also.
customer_reviews.author: GPS Man

customer_reviews.title: This is great unless your desk is against a wall
customer_reviews.text: This is great unless your desk is against a wall. From the pictures, it looks like you can run 2 monitors side by side and not have the arms protrude backwards. But that is only if you are using 30"+ monitors. I mounted two 24" Dells to this, but in order to get them side by side, the arms had to be bent backward and stick about 10" behind the desk. But if you don't have that issue, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Ross G.

customer_reviews.title: here, look at this
customer_reviews.text: not what i expected but does the job i had for it very well. had to modify one of the monitors because it did not have the modern mounting system this machine was built to take advantage of. didn't break the monitor and was able to attach it to the arm without harm. sturdy as all get out and easy to set up, easy to adjust the lifting power to properly hold up the monitors. comes with all the tools you need to set it up and keep it working.
customer_reviews.author: just  john

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! This freed up so much extra desk space!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my desk at work. They far exceed my expectations. The mechanism in the arms makes the movements so effortless and fluid. Best part is they hold their position. I have one stationary monitor and the other two mounted on this arm. I have been using them for almost three weeks now and the arms haven not sagged or anything. Installation took less than five minutes and all of the brackets are very rigid. It is a great bang for your buck like almost all of the AmazonBasics products. I just wish they made a 3-monitor stand as well!
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, high-quality monitor arms that go great with a sit-stand desk.
customer_reviews.text: A bit of work to assemble and sort out the cord management, but once up and running it's fantastic. I use this with theand have a 21.5 monitor on one arm and a laptop with theon the other. Easy to adjust on the spot for the proper height when sitting or standing to work. It's very sturdy and appears to be of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Great product for great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great, stable, well built product that is priced very reasonably. I would definitely buy more if there was a need. One of my key points in reviewing was if the monitors were going to shake a little when I type, and it doesn't!
customer_reviews.author: Marcello

customer_reviews.title: Poor assembly
customer_reviews.text: Was assembled incorrectly at the factory, returned and reordered and the same thing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install (I did the drill through install not the clamp on). I will say - I though from the description and photos that i would be able to pass the wires through the same hole as the bolt - but there was no room - so i ended up drilling a new 2 inch hole right behind the mount to run my monitor cables through (using this for a stand up desk so trying to keep everything clean and tidy), Minor disappointment - but the arms themselves are super sturdy, easy to set up and stay in place where you put them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Bort

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful. I have four monitors on my desk
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. I have four monitors on my desk, and two used to be on single arms and two on stands. When an offer for these came along I bought two sets: the best purchase I've made in at least a couple of years. Easy to assemble and fit, nicely finished, both sets replaced the existing arms/stands inside an hour. And I've got my desk surface back. Thanks, Amazon! Don't let the Basics name mislead you - these are well made articulating arms worth a good deal more than the $150 a set I paid. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: designinca

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described and for a reasonable price. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and for a reasonable price. It was capable to give the exact multiscreen configuration I needed and had the standard vesa mounting my screens had. My only suggestion is to have the hex key that comes with it to tighten each arm into locking position, to be a little shorter on the side that fits into the hex head. Had to cut down mine because the hex heads on the arms that attach to the main piece on the table lined up directly opposite each other. The hex key was too long to fit between them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: Arm not able to hold my 27inch acer predator anymore
customer_reviews.text: After a month, the arm holding my acer predator (17.6LB) is not capable to hold the monitor anymore even when the specifications suppose to hold up to 20LB monitor. When I try to adjust the arm height, the gas/spring system of the arm gives up. I'm going to try to get some support from Amazon and see what they have to say. [UPDATE] After doing some research, the arm has a screw that helps increase the tension, and I'm adding another star because is possible to fix the problem, however, the manual doesn't mention those screws at all, only others for some horizontal movement.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient max height
customer_reviews.text: For my monitor, the mounting screws attach near the top of the screen. I'm 6' tall, and for me the maximum height of the arm wasn't sufficient to get the top of my monitor at eye level. Seems like an oversight on the design of the item, since plenty of folks are taller than me and plenty of monitors have similar sorts of attachments. Seems to defeat the point for an ergonomics product. I fixed my issue by purchasing an extension bracket for my monitor. - something like this:  , but be wary that those won't fit if your mounting screws are "inset" rather than flush with the back of your monitor. Wouldn't recommend for anyone taller than 5'9
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor Stand at a Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Application: Home office with standing desk and two VA-2446 ViewSonic 24inch TFT monitors. Excellent packaging; delivered in a sturdy box; good assembly instructions. Easy to assemble and easy to adjust. Have used several name brand monitor arms and the Amazon Basics is every bit as good and at a much better price. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good mount, good value
customer_reviews.text: The arms have enough downward reach to keep my 24in monitor at a good height even when it's clamped to the upper shelf of my cheap old computer desk. It let me reclaim some desktop space and move the monitor back a few inches vs using its stand, plus I use it with the notebook tray to keep a small laptop over to one side for movies or email while I'm doing heavier stuff on my main workstation. It's better than some monitor arms I've seen that were priced a lot higher.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Heironimus

customer_reviews.title: Great product once you get the tension right
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. After tightening the tension, this is able to support a 34" ultra-wide (landscape) without drooping. I have a 29" ulta-wide on the other arm in portrait orientation. It just barely clears my keyboard, so if you're planning on having a portrait monitor, I would recommend using at most a 27". I also decided to put a block of wood between the clamp and my desk so it wouldn't scratch the surface at all.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not as flexible as you think
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy.. but not as flexible as I thought it would be. The arm can't raise up that high.. and the monitors don't really tilt down, they only tilt up. I bought both the single arm and double arm for my set up. It's nice I guess. But for the price and for what it does I wouldn't buy it again. If I would have known that the arms arent as flexible as i thought I definitely wouldn't of bought them in the first place. But it works to a certain extent so it's not worth my time to return it.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: kind of outdated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mount my two computer monitors, but one of the monitors wasn't compatible, so it is now a TV mount for a 32" TV and I am very happy with it. I only gave it four stars because of the incompatibility, as a TV mount--five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought these monitor stands years ago. They really add extra work space to my desk. I have mount 2 Samsung Curve 32" monitors with no issues. I did have to adjust the tension as per the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Viscomi

customer_reviews.title: Arm does not work
customer_reviews.text: Arm does not work.. it does not move or tilt when the screws are loosen, my monitor stays in one position... I’m totally bummed... I’m getting a replacement.... hoping it works as designed. I’m only giving it a 1 because I have to.... it is not useable at all!! 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Deb klingensmith

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, firm movement requires two hands, mounting options are OK but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good product however I'm giving it -1 star because the bottom mount option (bolting it through a hold int he table) is pretty limited. I have a standard table with standard hole for cables (about 2.5 inches diameter) and I can't mount it because the bracket is too small and won't grip properly. Still a great product and the rear mount clamp over the back edge of the table is solid and the arms work very well. They are pretty stiff which is better than being loose but adjusting the monitors requires two hands and a firm grip.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher V. Gordy

customer_reviews.title: Tilt tension adjustment doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: As many have noted, a very significant defect of this product is one screw, which is supposed to adjust the tension of monitor tilt. This does not work for my product. I almost returned this item, but was able to brute force the tilt before putting my monitors on. That way, I avoided the issue most 1 star reviews have of their monitors perpetually pointing upwards. However, I can not adjust tilt without enough force to snap my monitors, so this is functionally unadjustable. It is a shame for this to occur in a “premium” high-end and expensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Do recommend to insert the screw to keep it level unless ...
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to put it all together. First time buying. Have 2 27 inch monitors attached to it and once you figure it all out it is fantasic. Just take your time when putting it together. I didn't and was installing for the one with a hole in the table. Ill report back in 6 months or so for an update. If you never used these before give it a couple of weeks to get used to. Do recommend to insert the screw to keep it level unless you want to turn the monitor in portrait mold. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: TLH

customer_reviews.title: It works great, just wish it was higher, and cables were better concealed
customer_reviews.text: It absolutely does what it's supposed to do. It supports my 2 Viewsonic 27" LCD monitors well. The built in cable management is pretty good, I wish the wires weren't exposed on the upper section. I just wish the post from the desktop that has the "Y' connector was taller, I would like to have the monitors have greater height off the desk. It was easy to put together. and is virtually the same product that Ergotron sells for $90.00 more, the difference is the base is black. Which actually I prefer, the chrome gets dingy looking fast.
customer_reviews.author: Que

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I have a 27" Dell flat screen on one and Dell 17" flat screen on other. For the smaller Dell screen, I only used 2 of the 3 arms as I wanted to position it a certain way. It was very simple to setup this way and just as easy to modify. I am pleased with ease of moving the arms up/down and the large screen "mostly" stays in position I want, but I do notice it kinda wants to return to the position I most keep it in. I have not rotated screen (while writing code) so I don't know how well that feature works.
customer_reviews.author: Cust8e0

customer_reviews.title: Great Dual Mount Stand.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this monitor stand. Solid construction and sturdy. I have two 24in monitors installed. Wish I would have found this last year. Good buy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Solid, sturdy dual monitor stand.
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this monitor stand for my dual monitor setup. I chose to drill a 3/8 inch hole in my table top and the stand bolted very securely to it. I was especially pleased with the cable management facility. It was more expensive than some, but the versatility and quality were worth it for me. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT FIT MY MSI MONITOR
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this a great review. The arm mounts are very nice and seem good quality. But sadly these did not fit my MSI monitor, even though they both state they are compatible with each other. I have the MSI OPTIX MPG27CQ monitor, and I also tested the arms on a MSI MAG270CR and it didn't fit. Have to return :(
customer_reviews.author: RinkaShikitokaTTV

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've been working as an ergonomist for over 5 years and have seen and used quite a few different monitor arms, stands and mounts and have to say for the money I don't think you can beat these arms. I've used a few that are a bit smoother making them a little easier to adjust but you'll pay almost twice what you'll pay for these. I set up the double on one desk and a single on the other desk we have and we love them. We've been using them for a couple months now and they seem very sturdy, move well and I know that Amazon will stand behind it if I have any issues down the line...
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl L Finney

customer_reviews.title: I think it would have been better to buy two single arms.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 34-inch monitor and a 32-inch curved monitor. If there is no space between the desk and the wall, you cannot attach two monitors without space, unless one of them is a small monitor less than 24 inches. After all, only one monitor is using the arm. I think it would have been better to buy two single arms.
customer_reviews.author: Hithat

customer_reviews.title: Automatically comes down.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product originally. But soon it started to sag. I’ve two 27’ monitors which this stand supposed to support per their description. However, it doesn’t stay in the higher position and automatically comes down. Won’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Manas Agrawal

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for the Price Paid
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the materials and construction is quite good, with parts to accommodate a vise to grip the edge of the desk or a clamp to use in a hole (if your desk is so designed). I quite like the monitor display, but it does not raise high enough for my preference, and the instructions are not clear on how extend the arms vertically. It's quite a good value and quality for the price, and having both my monitors more at eye level provides me with a better ergonomic workstation at home.
customer_reviews.author: Rich W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mount Especially for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the Ergotron LX Dual side by side monitor mount, but in black and for a MUCH lower price. Personally I think Ergotron make some the best mounts on the market and have never had any issues installing and using them. This AmazonBasics version has the same, solid build quality, and I do actually prefer the black.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Henwood

customer_reviews.title: Worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: Steep, I know. But you get what you pay for: I can't do without it anymore. The arms are capable of holding this 29" ultra wide from Dell (U2913WM) without significant jiggle from typing or playing MIDI. I adjust it frequently, and the tension doesn't seem to be deteriorating anytime soon. Overall, even as a student I think made up for the cost of this stand with a few weeks of work. My most substantial complaint with this is the maximum height. A few more centimeters would've suited my use case better, but also increased jiggle. If I had to reconsider this purchase I would go with a wall mount version.
customer_reviews.author: Ian C

customer_reviews.title: Tilt Tension Defect for Both Arms
customer_reviews.text: Like other recently 1 star reviews, this product arrived with a tilt tension defect (for both arms). After mounting my monitors on the arm, adjusting the tilt tension screw, the monitors continued to face the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend the extra money to buy this dual monitor stand. I saw cheaper versions online and I didn't know if it was worth it to spend almost 200 bucks on this. However, the quality of this stand is immediately apparent once you set it up. It is made out of quality materials and has a weight/sturdiness that makes you feel comfortable with the purchase. It fully articulates in every conceivable direction and the monitors have that satisfying "glide" as you adjust them. I wish I would have bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Ray

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of purchasing this product before I was ready to use it. Once I had my setup complete I opened the box, put everything together and the arm mechanics broke upon trying to loosen one of the arms. Now I can't return the item and it is completely useless. Absolutely dissatisfied with the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: The buyer

customer_reviews.title: Simply excellent!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this, I feared it might not work out for my monitor setup: Namely, I run a pair of huge monitors (a LG 31MU97, and a Dell U3011). The Dell is also right at the weight limit. Well, the fears were unfounded. These arms handle both without breaking a sweat (just need to adjust the tension screw on the upper arm, which may be eluding some people who complain this is dropping to the desk with 24" monitors). The amount of desk space I've reclaimed is truly impressive. I highly recommend this pair of arms.
customer_reviews.author: Amatsukaze

customer_reviews.title: These ARE Ergotron Brand - Privately Labeled for Amazon. Same Quality. Same Greatness!
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely made by Ergotron for Amazon. Identical everything. I have ordered HUNDREDS of Ergotron LX mounts and when I ordered this, it was identical. The packaging is more efficient, because it's by Amazon, but parts and pieces were in identical packaging, identical letters on each of the hardware pouches, and I even mixed and matched a few of the monitor screws - all the same. This is a black finish which is really cool. When you buy Ergotron, you are buying QUALITY products. These are Ergotron made for certain. If you don't care about Ergotron's amazing shiny brushed steel appearance and just want the function - there is no reason you shouldn't get these instead. They're great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan from Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Worth half the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is riddled with defective screws and some that are the wrong size wrench from what they supply. Laughable. This thing is not worth anywhere near the price. I was replacing a $30 arm and I (almost) prefer that one to this. Don't bother with this arm, there are plenty of options out there.
customer_reviews.author: guy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, highly recommended !!
customer_reviews.text: I went through a few dual monitor mounts and this one by far was the best one. Great quality and will hold 35 inch monitors. Just remember that you will have to adjust the hydraulic that's located inside the top arms with a Allen key. They have a great range of motion. Price is kind of steep though.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lichliter

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed many monitor arms here on Amazon and other sites, including direct manufacturer's sites, and decided to purchase the AmazonBasics Side-by-Side monitor arms. I am very happy with the product. Solid arms that support my two Dell 24" monitors with easy. You have the ability to adjust the tension on the arms so the arms are easy to move but hold the monitors completely in place. Very satisfied with this purchase and would recommend them to anyone looking for dual monitor support.
customer_reviews.author: Moonjo

customer_reviews.title: 25 inch and 34 inch ultra wide monitors work perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not too hard to build it holds my 34 inch Alienware AW3418DW on the right with no problems just gotta adjust the resistance a little and my Alienware AW2518H 25 inch on the left. You do need some room in the back maybe like a few inches. My desk is 27.5 inches front to back and 48 inches left to right. And yes if I pull out my desk a more a can push the monitors perfectly aligned farther back on my desk so the monitors aren’t so close to my face. Hope this helps :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for something like this for a while
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something like this for a while. It was a great purchase, especially since I got a refurbished for a discount. It can be a little stiff to move around at times, but I haven't spent much time messing with it to adjust the tightness and all that. I have a 27" LG LED monitor on one side and an ASUS 24" (might be slightly bigger) on the other. Helped clear up space on the desk. Clamp looks sturdy, and works great so far. Wish I'd purchased this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: VAF84

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: The product is solid and stable and does what it is supposed to do. However, if you have a desk up against a wall you lose desk space as the arm push the screens forward due to the angles they need. At least that is the case with my 2 side by side 22inch monitors. If you are in a open space this is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice!
customer_reviews.text: The AmazonBasics Dual Side-by-Side Monitor display is an awesome addition to my desk; I just wish I had ordered one sooner! I have a 28" touch screen acer as my main monitor, and my laptop as the second (sitting on amazonbasics laptop tray). The arms easily hold my larger monitor (it's right at the max recommended weight). Combined with my standing desk, the monitor arms are enabling more efficient huddles in my office, and improving my ergonomics when it's just me. I love being able to flip around my monitor while I'm meeting with someone.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Basics Logo on Base
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is well enough, good range of motion and ability to tighten torque. One thing I was really put off by: There's no shortage of "Amazon Basics" logos on this arm, including very prominently on the base. I don't know why Amazon felt the need to NASCAR their monitor arms but, well, they did. So if you're looking for a clean, simple looking pair of monitor arms for your desk -- you best look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Save money, buy unbranded
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 3 unbranded monitor stands before, for 2-3 monitors, all $60-90. They work almost the same as this one - they use screws and springs for resistance, which means you can’t easily or precisely adjust them. This advertises it uses gas but it’s just a metal spring. It doesn’t height adjust. It doesn’t have a good range of motion. It’s triple the cost of products that are built the same but at least those have height adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Amir Azadi

customer_reviews.title: Not Stable, Too Low, Not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: First, the good: It holds two monitors. Now, the bad: 1) the mounting plate is too large for some monitors. 2) The range of motion is too small. It does not elevate enough. 3) It is very wobbly 4) Near impossible to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with two 32'' monitors
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this stand for about six months with two 32'' widescreen monitors and am very happy with it. The monitors are probably a bit big for the length of the arms (each monitor is 28 3/4" wide), but it works. I haven't had to adjust the tension since I first installed it, and I move the monitors around a lot.
customer_reviews.author: NYCUWS

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, just wish it moved slightly easier.
customer_reviews.text: There are adjustments we played with a little, but did not go crazy. They are a bit hard to move up and down once set, but the left and right motion is a breeze and it is still sturdy. A definite yes!
customer_reviews.author: 78Foxes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered both the single-monitor arm and the dual-monitor arm, for different work areas. Both of them were super-easy to install and the quality is very good. Especially for the price! I opted to use the grommet mount rather than the clamp mount. Very sturdy. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: GoXplore

customer_reviews.title: Nice for most, won't fit my executive desk
customer_reviews.text: I still have these laying on the floor :( It won't clamp around an exercise desk. On my desk and I think most executive desks, there is a thick shirt or base that this thing can't clamp onto. Must use a cheaper desk OR thru the cable hole that exists on most desks. (Make sure you have the home and if you have a glass desk it's cut so the mount can be installed properly)
customer_reviews.author: Colby Neal

customer_reviews.title: Not an Ergo Solution Of Tall
customer_reviews.text: These are way too short. I am tall and aside from clearing clutter from my desk look to Get my monitors into an ergo position. It's ashame, because it would only take increasing the post height a few inches to !she then more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Nowaks

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and will hold almost any monitor ...
customer_reviews.text: As always, there is nothing basic about AmazonBasics. This stand is solid beyond belief. Easy to put together and will hold almost any monitor you can think of. Currently I have mounted two 28"s and I have 8" of room between the two monitors. For the price/quality/flexibility this monitor stand is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: DaDane
